title: PPSC SDEO PERA Phase II (Dec 2025)
description: Complete General Knowledge exam covering Geography, Computer Science, Biology, Math, English, and Urdu. Based on actual PPSC SDEO PERA exam held December 2025.

questions.question: "Monsoon" refers to:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: The word 'Monsoon' comes from Arabic 'Mausim' meaning season. It refers to a seasonal change in wind direction. In South Asia, this results in wet summers (winds from sea) and dry winters (winds from land).

questions.question: Which country is known as the "Land of Thousand Lakes"?
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: Finland has approximately 188,000 lakes formed by glacial melting during the last Ice Age, earning it the nickname 'Land of a Thousand Lakes'.

questions.question: The Sur Range (Salt Range area) is famous for:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: The Salt Range and Surghar Range in Punjab, Pakistan contain significant deposits of coal (mostly Lignite), gypsum, and salt. Used in brick kilns and power generation.

questions.question: The Kirthar Range lies on the boundary of which two provinces?
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: The Kirthar Mountains form a natural boundary between Sindh and Balochistan. The highest peak is Zardak. It is also part of the Kirthar National Park.

questions.question: Tectonic plates meet in Pakistan's South-West region. Which plates are these?
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: Pakistan is located at the collision zone of the Indian Plate and the Eurasian Plate. This geological activity formed the Himalayas and causes frequent earthquakes in the region.

questions.question: The Karachi-Chaman-Quetta highway is known as:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: The N-25 National Highway (also known as the RCD Highway) connects Karachi to Chaman via Quetta. It is a major trade route connecting Pakistan to Afghanistan and Iran.

questions.question: Gwadar lies on which sea coast?
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: Gwadar is a port city on the southwestern coast of Balochistan, Pakistan, bordering the Arabian Sea. It is the centerpiece of the CPEC project.

questions.question: The Neelum-Jhelum Hydropower project is located in:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: The Neelum-Jhelum project is a run-of-the-river hydroelectric power scheme in Azad Kashmir, near Muzaffarabad. It diverts water from the Neelum River to the Jhelum River.

questions.question: Pakistan is NOT a member of which organization?
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: ASEAN (Association of Southeast Asian Nations) is a regional bloc of 10 Southeast Asian states. Pakistan is a Sectoral Dialogue Partner but not a full member. Pakistan IS a member of SAARC, OIC, UN, and SCO.

questions.question: The Permanent Secretariat to coordinate the action of SAARC is in:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: The Secretariat of SAARC was established in Kathmandu, Nepal, on January 16, 1987.

questions.question: The Pak-China border agreement was held in the year:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: The Sino-Pakistan Frontier Agreement was signed on March 2, 1963. Pakistan ceded some disputed territory to China, and China recognized Pakistani sovereignty over Gilgit-Baltistan.

questions.question: Operation Gibraltar was held in which year?
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: Operation Gibraltar was the codename for a military operation launched by Pakistan in August 1965 to infiltrate Kashmir, which triggered the Indo-Pak War of 1965.

questions.question: The IMF headquarters is in:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: Both the IMF and World Bank are headquartered in Washington, D.C., USA. They were established following the Bretton Woods Conference in 1944.

questions.question: The "Great Wall of Sindh" refers to:
questions.subject: Geography
questions.explanation: Ranikot Fort (near Jamshoro) is believed to be the world's largest fort, with a circumference of approximately 32 kilometers. It is often called the Great Wall of Sindh.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of Freeware?
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: Freeware is software available for use at no monetary cost. Oracle VirtualBox is free to use. Other examples include Chrome browser, Skype, etc.

questions.question: The "Conditional Formatting" option is present in MS Excel under:
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: Conditional Formatting (used to highlight cells based on values) is located in the Home tab in the 'Styles' group.

questions.question: Which shortcut is used to insert a new slide in PowerPoint?
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: Ctrl + M inserts a New Slide in the current presentation. Ctrl + N opens a New Presentation.

questions.question: Which tab is used to insert a footnote in MS Word?
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: Footnotes and Endnotes are citations placed at the bottom of the page. You find them in the References tab (Shortcut: Ctrl+Alt+F).

questions.question: Which AI Platform is commonly used to assist in generating text for emails?
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: ChatGPT (by OpenAI) is a Large Language Model (LLM) designed to generate human-like text, widely used for drafting emails, essays, and code.

questions.question: DeepMind's tool for solving protein folding is called:
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: DeepMind (Google subsidiary) created AlphaFold, an AI system that predicts a protein's 3D structure from its amino acid sequence, solving a 50-year-old biology challenge.

questions.question: What is the maximum zoom percentage in MS Excel?
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: Excel Max Zoom: 400%, Word Max Zoom: 500%, PowerPoint Max Zoom: 400%.

questions.question: Which is present in all viruses?
questions.subject: Everyday Science
questions.explanation: Viruses contain either DNA or RNA (never both), but Guanine is a nitrogenous base present in BOTH DNA and RNA. Therefore, regardless of virus type, Guanine will be found.

questions.question: The concept of Homeostasis refers to:
questions.subject: Everyday Science
questions.explanation: Homeostasis is the process by which living organisms regulate their internal environment (temperature, pH, water level) to maintain a stable, constant condition.

questions.question: Which of the following allows electricity to pass in a molten state?
questions.subject: Everyday Science
questions.explanation: An Electrolyte is a substance that produces an electrically conducting solution when dissolved in a polar solvent or melted. It contains free-moving ions.

questions.question: Tibia and Fibula bones are present in:
questions.subject: Everyday Science
questions.explanation: Leg (Hind Limb): Femur (thigh), Tibia (shin), Fibula (calf). Arm (Fore Limb): Humerus, Radius, Ulna.

questions.question: If x/y = 9/40, then (x+y)/(x-y) = ?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: If y = x² - 9, how many times does it intercept the y-axis?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: A function intercepts the y-axis when x = 0. Substituting: y = 0 - 9 = -9. There is only one unique value for y when x = 0. Therefore, it intercepts the y-axis exactly once.

questions.question: If 2:4 = 6:?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2:4 simplifies to 1:2 (the second number is double the first). So, 6:? must also be 1:2. Therefore ? = 12.

questions.question: Evaluate: (3/1) × (4/3) × (5/4) × (17/16)
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Notice the diagonal cancellation: numerators cancel with denominators of next fraction. Remaining: 17/1 = 17.

questions.question: A Parallelogram has sides 15cm and 10cm. Find the perimeter.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Perimeter of a parallelogram = 2(length + width) = 2(15 + 10) = 2 × 25 = 50 cm.

questions.question: Area of an equilateral triangle is (9/16)√3. Find the length of side.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Area of Equilateral Triangle = (√3/4)a². Given (9/16)√3 = (√3/4)a². Solving: a² = 9/4, so a = 3/2.

questions.question: "Mauwazatain" means:
options: Two Surahs of Quran (Surah Falaq & Surah Naas)
questions.subject: Islamiat
questions.explanation: Al-Mu'awwidhatayn refers to the last two Surahs of the Quran (Surah Al-Falaq and Surah An-Naas), which are recited for protection.

questions.question: "Ghasibana" in English means:
questions.subject: English
questions.explanation: Usurpation means taking someone's power or property by force or illegally. (Urdu: Ghasab karna).

questions.question: Mynah : Bird :: Terrapin : ?
questions.subject: English
questions.explanation: This is an analogy. A Mynah is a type of Bird. A Terrapin is a type of small Turtle living in fresh or brackish water.

questions.question: Happening after one's death is called:
questions.subject: English
questions.explanation: Posthumous: Occurring after the death of the originator (e.g., a posthumous award). Post-mortem: An examination of a dead body.

questions.question: Which word correctly completes: 'No one _____ about one's future plan.'
questions.subject: English
questions.explanation: 'Knows' is the most appropriate verb here. 'Descry' means to catch sight of, which doesn't fit the context.

questions.question: ROM is a:
questions.subject: Computer
questions.explanation: ROM (Read-Only Memory) is a type of non-volatile memory hardware that stores instructions permanently (like BIOS). Data on ROM cannot be easily modified.

questions.question: بھیڑ کی کھٹی کھانا (Bheray ki khutti khana) means:
questions.subject: Urdu
questions.explanation: This Urdu idiom means to take a fatal risk or commit suicide. It literally refers to eating poisonous berries.

questions.question: چغلش (Chughalish) means:
questions.subject: Urdu
questions.explanation: Chughalish refers to conflict, dispute, or a verbal fight.

questions.question: دال نہ گلنا (Daal na galna) is a:
questions.subject: Urdu
questions.explanation: Daal na galna is an idiom meaning 'to not succeed' or 'tricks not working'.
